text:
Nothing @potus told the states today inconsistent with that. 

Politicians, pundits on all sides & the media need to stop playing gotcha games with #COVID19. 

There aren’t two sides on this matter,there is only one.
RT @WHNSC Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown. @CDCgov has and will continue to post the latest guidance on #COVID19. #coronavirus

Our public health workers are courageously fighting #COVID19 on the frontlines of this pandemic, putting their own health at risk. We can do our part to ensure we don’t get sick—stay home, help to flatten the curve & limit the concentration of cases coming into our hospitals. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1239323007685996546 QT @nytimes 2 emergency medicine doctors, one in New Jersey and the other in Washington State, are in critical condition as a result of coronavirus, the American College of Emergency Physicians said https://trib.al/8GpaVil
As much as we can we should all #StayHomeSaveLives

Scandinavians don’t “feel the Bern” — they want Bernie to tell the truth that Nordic success came from capitalism. Exactly the point that ⁦@KelleyAshbyPaul⁩ and I make in The Case Against Socialism.

Bernie Sanders is wrong on democratic socialism... https://www.nbcnews.com/think/opinion/bernie-sanders-wrong-democratic-socialism-sweden-everywhere-else-ncna1158636

RT @NydiaVelazquez Last week, @Ayanna Pressley, @AOC & @RashidaTlaib & I penned a letter to the Director of the Fed. Bureau of Prisons asking for a plan to prevent an outbreak.  Prisoners are especially susceptible to #COVID19 due to poor sanitation and close proximity. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/16/opinion/coronavirus-in-jails.html

During the 2008 financial crisis, our government responded with a giant bankers' bailout & too little for working families. Read my new op-ed on the lessons from 2008 & why we must deliver a grassroots stimulus package directly to working families. https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/16/opinions/grassroots-stimulus-package-coronavirus-warren/index.html

#smallbiz can apply starting tomorrow here👇

Ease the burden on students by allowing unexpected travel, housing, storage costs to factor in to Pell Grant award amounts.

RT @TheRickyDavila Something that isn’t mentioned enough, Speaker Nancy Pelosi led the charge for the House Coronavirus Relief Bill and she convinced many House Republicans to support it.

She’s a badass. She really is.

The way to fix this is to turn future tax credit value into current cash flow. That requires loans. My expansion of SBA loan guarantees would give banks the certainty they need to make credit available to small businesses 3/4

A grassroots stimulus includes:
✅ Closing the paid leave policy gaps
✅ Increasing Social Security checks by $200/month
✅ Canceling student loan debt
✅ Halting evictions/foreclosures & helping homeowners
✅ Investing in affordable housing

We have to make a choice. What kind of nation do we want to be?

Do we want to work together to tackle the problems facing this country, or be one where nothing fundamentally changes for the people with power who make huge amounts of money on greed and corruption?

Something you can do while you’re at home protecting yourself from the coronavirus: complete the 2020 Census. It's critical that with everything going on, you and your community are represented. You can participate by phone, mail, or online at http://my2020census.gov.

We do not protect our way of life when we treat the Fourth Amendment as optional. Instead, we erode trust in our institutions and undermine the very values we claim to defend.  https://www.foxnews.com/opinion/sen-rand-paul-my-fisa-reform-amendment-will-keep-america-safe

No one should go bankrupt due to medical bills.

No one should avoid a doctor because they can't afford it.

No one should watch a loved one die because they were uninsured.

We must end this injustice and pass Medicare for All.
Defer the payment of student loans for a period of time to ease the burden of those who are just graduating now.

People have harped on me about “Trojan horse” comments I’ve made before abt UBI policies,but seriously: not every UBI policy is created equal.

Some are structured in predatory ways to gut the safety net & reward banks, others are better w/people’s well-being in mind. Be careful.

Federal stimulus money to giant corporations needs strings attached to ensure that the money goes to save jobs, not to investors or executive bonuses. And if giant corporations get loans, they should be required to put workers on corporate boards.

Look out for each other. Check in on your family, friends, and neighbors—particularly those who are most vulnerable. No one needs to feel that they're on their own. Remember that we're all in this together. https://www.vox.com/2020/3/12/21173938/coronavirus-covid-19-social-distancing-elderly-epidemic-isolation-quarantine

Currently @IHSgov, tribal health programs, & urban Indian health programs aren't ensured access to the Strategic National Stockpile of drugs & medical supplies for a public health emergency like coronavirus. @SenatorTomUdall & I have a bill for that. https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/senators-warren-and-udall-unveil-bill-to-guarantee-tribal-health-authorities-access-to-the-strategic-national-stockpile

For a NYT editorial writer to selectively edit this quote—and to omit the President’s explicit commitment “WE WILL BE BACKING YOU”—which was the very next sentence, is deceptive & affirmatively misleading. In this time of crisis, the media has a responsibility to do much better. https://twitter.com/michaeljknowles/status/1239631451819106304 QT @michaeljknowles It seems @MaraGay's reading comprehension is no better than her arithmetic.

Here's the full quote: “...the equipment—try getting it yourselves. We will be backing you, but try getting it yourselves. Point of sales, much better, much more direct if you can get it yourself.” https://twitter.com/MaraGay/status/1239603785275670529

RT @RedCross What do blood and platelet donations have to do with #coronavirus? As concerns rise, there may be fewer people eligible to give blood. Giving is a safe process and your donation will help keep the blood supply stable. Make an appointment: https://www.redcrossblood.org/give.html/find-drive?cid=biomedical&med=social&source=arctwitter&campdesc=mar0920 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ESsTUx8XYAA3Vav.jpg

RT @EvelynNFarkas While @SpeakerPelosi was working to pass legislation for free #coronavirus testing & paid sick leave, #MoscowMitch was planning a Senate recess.

It is nothing short of dereliction of duty. The Senate must act immediately—our great nation deserves better.

https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/12/politics/congress-recess-canceled/index.html
Every American adult should immediately receive a one-time check for $1,000 to help ensure families and workers can meet their short-term obligations and increase spending in the economy.

MA has at least 164 cases of coronavirus & @MassGovernor has canceled school, closed restaurants, & banned gatherings to slow its spread. These steps in MA & across the country are critical to stop the virus, but our economy will need support to weather this crisis.

The one way we are not going to solve this crisis is through racism. We need real leadership now more than ever. https://twitter.com/realdonaldtrump/status/1239685852093169664 QT @realDonaldTrump The United States will be powerfully supporting those industries, like Airlines and others, that are particularly affected by the Chinese Virus. We will be stronger than ever before!

RT @SenTedCruz We must pursue every step necessary to develop a vaccine & a cure for #COVID19. My RESULTs for Coronavirus Patients Act would allow @US_FDA 30 days to approve pharmaceutical/medical devices approved in another major developed country to help increase access to #coronavirus cures.

Immigrants shouldn't fear going to a hospital in the middle of a pandemic.

Today, I’m calling on DHS Official Ken Cuccinelli to make a public statement that ICE and CBP will avoid immigration enforcement in public health facilities during the coronavirus pandemic.

I’m grateful that the Tribal Medical Supplies Stockpile Access Act has support from @NIHB1, @NCAI1944, @NCUIH_Official, @USETINC SPF, @SIHB1, & @FCNL. I’ll continue to fight for the health & welfare of Native peoples & address the barriers to sovereignty facing Indian Country.
To all our nation’s health care workers and first responders: thank you. We are forever grateful for your hard work and sacrifice.

We know we all have a role to play in fighting #COVID19 and that includes:
✅Practicing social distancing
✅Regularly washing our hands for 20 seconds
✅Avoiding crowds
✅Staying home from work or school if we feel sick

Remember: we’re all in this together.

We must ensure that @IHSgov, tribal nations, & Native communities are prepared to confront the coronavirus outbreak head-on, & empower Indian Country to tackle a public health crisis. That’s what the Tribal Medical Supplies Stockpile Access Act does.

Americans need life-saving treatments to #COVID19 as soon as possible. That’s why I called on @SteveFDA to expand the FDA’s Parallel Track and I introduced in the Senate legislation to expedite the FDA approval process for drugs and devices approved in other countries. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETO2cfhXYAAk4xK.jpg

With more people staying home to stem this crisis, shutting off water, electricity, internet, and phone services for those who can’t pay their bills could have devastating consequences. That's why I’m calling on companies to end shutoffs and I thank those that have already acted.
"We will get through this": Sen. Ted Cruz comments on second self-quarantine https://abc13.com/health/sen-ted-cruz-comments-on-his-second-self-quarantine/6013688/ via @ABC13Houston

The House bill creates tax credits to offset the cost of providing paid leave. What businesses need, though, is cash flow today. A tax credit that comes later means nothing to a small business that needs to make payroll tonight 2/4i

Today I’m calling on the IRS to move our tax filing deadline from April 15 to July 15, and to waive any interest and fees for late payment. This will allow those who owe money not to have to send it during our current situation.

"From self-quarantine, Cruz co-sponsored legislation he intends to introduce that, if passed, would expedite the U.S. FDA approval process for drugs and devices that could treat #COVID19 patients. It’s called the RESULTs for #Coronavirus Patients Act" https://www.tedcruz.org/news/wfaa-from-self-quarantine-sen-cruz-calls-to-talk-about-covid-19-pandemic/

Please stop spreading stupid rumors about marshall law. 

COMPLETELY FALSE

We will continue to see closings & restrictions on hours of non-essential businesses in certain cities & states. But that is NOT marshall law.

I'll be on @AllInWithChris soon to talk about why we need a stimulus package that directly helps working families. If we want to weather this crisis, we need to support our economy from the grassroots up.

Last week I called for a $750 billion stimulus to help families during the coronavirus crisis. I'm glad @SenSchumer & @SenateDems are proposing big structural changes to give working families relief right now. https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/487845-schumer-to-propose-at-least-750-billion-to-combat-coronavirus

We can do better than 2008 with an economic recovery focused on the grassroots up, not Wall Street down. A $750 billion grassroots stimulus package will match the challenges that families & communities face & help ward off economic disaster.

We all have a role in combatting #COVID19.
 
Below are some tips for how you can help prevent spread of the #coronavirus:
🤧Cover your sneeze or cough with a tissue.
🧼Wash your hands regularly.
🏠Stay home if you are sick.
📞Call your medical provider before going in person. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETPVQZ6WsAI9OTu.jpg

There is no question this pandemic is stretching our health care system and our economy, but it’s critically important we all do our part now to slow the spread of the virus. If you are able to, please stay home.

Yesterday I joined the @NAACP on a call to discuss how we can protect our communities against the coronavirus pandemic.

One point I made: check in on our elderly. Give them a call to brighten their day. Offer to get them groceries. Remember that isolation can lead to depression.

But they don’t have the buying power to generate a swift & massive industrial response

It will require a federal effort (maybe in collaboration with EU)to mobilize private sector action on the scale & pace required

1) Practice strict quarantine. Stay in your home, drive alone in your car, or walk by yourselves outdoors where others aren’t around. Avoid restaurants, movie theaters, shopping centers, and airplanes. Work from home until we know more.

@MichaelDTubbs I first starting learning about this from meeting w/ you! 💙

If you want to make real change and create an economy that works for all, you know what you need?

You need to take on Wall Street, the drug companies, the insurance companies, and the fossil fuel industry.

You don’t take campaign contributions from them.

BE CAREFUL with UBI proposals you see popping up.

They are not all created equal, & they can have large macroeconomic, inflationary & systemic effects.

Proposals should be weighed in a larger policy mix incl paymnt suspensions, jobs guarantee, unemp. expansion, paid leave,etc.

These proposals should be handled with care and consideration, particularly with respect to macroeconomic effects.

But they should be considered nevertheless.

Other countries are getting by w/ payment suspensions, which also creates that cash buffer. https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1239582664669253634 QT @AOC GOP & Democrats are both coming to the same conclusion: Universal Basic Income is going to have to play a role in helping Americans weather this crisis.

@RoKhanna & @TimRyan’s proposal goes up to $6,000/mo depending on need. Mitt Romney just came out for a flat $1,000 universal. https://twitter.com/jmartnyt/status/1239578864822767617

What we should seriously start to consider now for the medium & long term (bc it will take time) is New Deal-style policy.

We need a mix of policies to help put a lot of people to work. Climate transition, edu expansion w/ apprenticeships & colleges, M4A.

These are jobs bills.
Require insurance plans to temporarily cover telehealth for #COVID19 related services. This would help protect the health workforce and connect patients with providers.

Yes. Full transparency: My issues w/ non-emergency UBI have to do w/ domino effects that have not been sufficiently addressed: triggering mass disqualification thresholds on Medicaid, SNAP, & many other programs, inflationary concerns, etc.

I’m open to it but we need to bake it. https://twitter.com/seemiaroll/status/1239595351885127681 QT @SeeMiaRoll Yessssss 👏🏼👇🏼
Proposals such as this don’t just live in a fishbowl. They affect many other policies. If you implement the UBI, you must look at how it affects Medicaid/Medicare/SSI/SSDI/Food stamps/Inflation/Rent/etc. #CripTheVote https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1239586496048496641

Before this crisis, nearly half of Americans were a $400 unexpected expense away from financial hardship. That’s why I introduced the LIFT Act to give up to $6,000/yr to middle-class families.

Congress must act with emergency cash to help families and the economy now.

A Federal Jobs Guarantee is a complementary program that addresses some people’s immediate problem (lack of work) without pumping cash w/o productivity into the economy.

Jobs Guarantee does not solve the issue for everyone but it should also be considered in the policy mix.

Re-upping this urgent advice: Seniors & people with compromised health are at greater risk from #COVID19. How much greater? Of the first 803 Italian deaths reported, 98% were 60 or older. Data from other countries also show that older people have a much higher risk of death.

No one should ever be bankrupted because they got sick.

In the midst of this emergency, the U.S. government must be clear that everyone in our country must be able to get all of the health care they need without cost. Period. https://twitter.com/larry_levitt/status/1239589219070287872 QT @larry_levitt The average cost of a hospitalization for COVID-19 could top $20,000 for someone with private insurance, with patient-of-pocket costs of at least $1,300. The economic consequences for patients is a particularly American challenge.
https://www.healthsystemtracker.org/brief/potential-costs-of-coronavirus-treatment-for-people-with-employer-coverage/

It won’t change anything but wanted to leave it for the record

Given what #COVID19 did to #China & now #Italy political potshots from all sides are really trivial

If we don’t change the trajectory of our current infection rate, in a few days no one will care about politics

Michael Tubbs is the mayor of Stockton, CA who started a UBI pilot in his city long before the idea went mainstream.

They have been sending $500 debit cards to people in Stockton making <$46k.

It’s a limited, but real-life implementation and they have learned a lot. Google him! https://twitter.com/michaeldtubbs/status/1239601829622636544 QT @MichaelDTubbs I’ve learned that particularly in times of crisis and economic downtown, folks need and deserve an income floor- and we can do it.  It’s not a cure all but an important tool and am thankful you and other leaders are calling for it! #moneytothepeople  @stocktondemo https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1239598218679377925

Michael Tubbs es el alcalde de Stockton, CA quien empezó un programa piloto de IUB en su ciudad antes de que la idea se volviera común.

Ellos han estado mandando tarjetas de débito de $500 a las personas en Stockton ganando <$46mil. https://twitter.com/MichaelDTubbs/status/1239601829622636544 QT @MichaelDTubbs I’ve learned that particularly in times of crisis and economic downtown, folks need and deserve an income floor- and we can do it.  It’s not a cure all but an important tool and am thankful you and other leaders are calling for it! #moneytothepeople  @stocktondemo https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1239598218679377925

Necesitamos una mezcla de políticas para ayudar a poner a muchas personas a trabajar.  Una transición climatológica, expansión de la educación con aprendizajes & colegios, Medicare Para Todos. 

Estas son propuestas de ley de trabajos.
Lo que deberíamos seriamente comenzar ahora a plazo medio y a plazo largo (xq tomará tiempo) es una política al estilo el Nuevo Pacto.
Las propuestas deben ser sopesadas en una mezcla más grande de políticas incluyendo las suspensiones de pagos, la garantía de trabajos, la expansión del desempleo, la licencia pagada, etc.

TENGAN CUIDADO con las propuestas IUB que ven aparecer de repente. 

No todas son creadas de la misma forma, & pueden tener grandes efectos macroeconómicos, inflacionarios & sistemáticos.
La Garantía de Trabajos no resuelve el problema para todos pero también debe ser considerada en la mezcla de políticas.

Estoy abierta al IUB pero tenemos q hornearlo.

Una Garantía de Trabajos Federales es un programa complementario q aborda uno d los problemas inmediatos d alguna gente (la falta d trabajo) sin bombear efectivo sin productividad a la economía.

Sí. Siendo completamente transparente: Mis problemas con el IUB no d emergencia tienen q ver con el efecto dominó q no se ha abordado suficientemente: desencadenando umbrales d descalificación en Medicaid, SNAP, & muchos otros programas, las preocupaciones inflacionarias, etc. https://twitter.com/SeeMiaRoll/status/1239595351885127681 QT @SeeMiaRoll Yessssss 👏🏼👇🏼
Proposals such as this don’t just live in a fishbowl. They affect many other policies. If you implement the UBI, you must look at how it affects Medicaid/Medicare/SSI/SSDI/Food stamps/Inflation/Rent/etc. #CripTheVote https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1239586496048496641
Algunas están estructuradas de una manera predatoria para destruir la red de seguridad & recompensar a los bancos, otras son mejores con el bienestar de las personas en mente.  Tengan cuidado.
La gente me han machacado sobre los comentarios del “caballo de Troya” que he hecho antes sobre las políticas de IBU, pero en serio: no cada política IUB está hecha de igual forma.
El IUB no debe ser usado como una excusa para no hacer pausa a las hipotecas & a los pagos a las deudas estudiantiles, poniendo alto a los intereses, etc.

El efectivo es importante pero si lo haces sin suspensiones de pago entonces todavía son las personas cotidianas que tienen que pagar la cuenta.

Las corporaciones, los prestamistas, y los bancos necesitan hacer su parte. https://twitter.com/mehdirhasan/status/1239594034093592577 QT @mehdirhasan Needs to be more like 10k per adult, 5k minimum. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1239583661504303104

Pero deben de ser considerados de cualquier forma.

Otros países se las están arreglando con suspensiones de pago, lo cual también crea un amortiguador de efectivo.
Estas propuestas deben ser manejadas con cuidado y consideración, particularmente con respecto a los efectos macroeconómicos.
Ya sea IUB, suspensiones de la hipoteca/la renta/los préstamos, u otras formas, si no actuamos rápidamente mucha gente pasará hambre, o confrontará otros daños extremos.
